phrs.translation: 讨人喜欢地, 可爱地, 令人钟爱的

sentences.sentence: Whenever asked how long he expected his journey to take, he would always collapse endearingly into a fit of laughter.
sentences.translation: 无论什么时候问他准备在外旅行多长时间，他总会样子可爱地笑成一团。

sentences.sentence: Over the years he has been called Red Oskar, enfant terrible, the most dangerous man in Europe and, almost endearingly at times, Napoleon.
sentences.translation: 有的人则认为他是欧洲最危险的人，但有的时候却又是最受欢迎的人。 甚至有人把他比作拿破仑。

sentences.sentence: And the mischievous smiles on the faces of some of the bridesmaids and page boys – and endearingly bewildered expressions on the others – are strikingly similar.
sentences.translation: 同样几位小花童和小傧相的脸上绽放出灿烂的笑容，却也总有那麽几位脸上露出困惑的违和的表情。
